fields.description:
Here's a short summary of euca2ools 3.1 changes off the top of my
head.  Keep in mind that roughly half of it is on my short- to
medium-term to-do list, so if you see "TODO" marks next to something
that is what it means.

The following options, which were deprecated in euca2ools 3.0, have
been removed:

  -a/--access-key  (use -I/--access-key-id instead)
  -s (use -S/--secret-key instead)
  --delegate (use --as-account instead) (TODO)
  --config (source the file instead) (TODO)

~/.eucarc is no longer used automatically.  Source it instead.

As a result of the latter two, euca-* commands use the same sources
for URLs and access keys as other commands.  The separate "Order of
Precedence" sections for them may be removed.

The global "default-user" option has been removed.  (TODO)

The EUCA_REGION environment variable is deprecated.  Use
AWS_DEFAULT_REGION instead.  (TODO)

eustore-describe-images and eustore-install-image have been removed.
Go to emis.eucalyptus.com to obtain any pre-packaged images that
Eucalyptus Systems provides.

New command:  euca-fingerprint-key:  euca-describe-keypairs returns
the fingerprint of every key pair, but those fingerprints are not
necessarily the standard SSH key fingerprints that tools like
ssh-keygen will calculate.  euca-fingerprint-key, when given a file
containing a private key, will show this longer fingerprint.

New command:  euca-bundle-and-upload-image:  euca-bundle-image and
euca-upload-bundle, combined into a single command.  The bundle will
not be saved afterwards unless one explicitly asks the tool to do so.
This command is nearly complete, but needs me to implement one final
option:  --upload-policy.  Completing it is currently #1 on my list.
(TODO)

New command:  euca-download-and-unbundle:  does exactly what it sounds
like.  This mostly works, though I still need to go through it and do
some cleanup and sanity checking.  It is also largely complete,
though.  (TODO)

New command:  euca-unbundle-stream:  reads a bundle from a single file
descriptor like standard in and yields the image it contains.  This
command is not for the faint-hearted, as it requires the
image-specific encryption info that is normally part of the bundle's
manifest file.  If you have a bundle and its manifest, use
euca-unbundle instead.

Supplying the name of a service that appears in /etc/services to
euca-authorize's and euca-revoke's -p option will cause the command to
automatically look up the appropriate port number and use that.  For
example, "-P tcp -p postgres" has the same effect as "-P tcp -p 5432".

The configuration file that ships with euca2ools no longer specifies a
default region.

comments.body:
Hi, Scott,

Since it looks like you got saddled with all the euca2ools stuff again
I went and compiled a fairly exhaustive list of changes in euca2ools
3.0.3 and euca2ools 3.1.0.  All of 3.0.3's changes are also part of
3.1.0, so I simply prepended "3.0.3" to the changes that apply to both
of them.  If you need me to elaborate on something please let me know.

For synopses and option descriptions I recommend just grabbing the
tools (via packages or git) and running --help on them.  Everything
except euca-bundle-vol should work correctly now.  I will mail you
about euca-bundle-vol's changes, along with any other changes that I
have yet to implement, once I finish them.

==== New commands ====

euca-bundle-and-upload-image
euca-download-and-unbundle-image
euca-fingerprint-key
euca-modify-instance-attribute
euca-unbundle-stream

== IAM role, instance profile commands ==
euare-instanceprofileaddrole
euare-instanceprofilecreate
euare-instanceprofiledel
euare-instanceprofilegetattributes
euare-instanceprofilelistbypath
euare-instanceprofilelistforrole
euare-instanceprofileremoverole
euare-roleaddpolicy
euare-rolecreate
euare-roledel
euare-roledelpolicy
euare-rolegetattributes
euare-rolegetpolicy
euare-rolelistbypath
euare-rolelistpolicies
euare-roleupdateassumepolicy
euare-roleuploadpolicy

== CloudFormation commands (Uses AWS_CLOUDFORMATION_URL, cloudformation-url) ==
euform-cancel-update-stack
euform-create-stack
euform-delete-stack
euform-describe-stack-events
euform-describe-stack-resource
euform-describe-stack-resources
euform-describe-stacks
euform-get-template
euform-list-stack-resources
euform-list-stacks
euform-update-stack
euform-validate-template

== Import commands (part of the EC2 set) ==
euca-cancel-conversion-task
euca-delete-disk-image
euca-describe-conversion-tasks
euca-import-instance
euca-import-volume
euca-resume-import

==== Removed features ====

The global "default-user" configuration option has been removed after
it caused confusion with regions' "user" option.  Use the * region for
this purpose instead.

euare-* --delegate has been removed.  Use --as-account instead.

euca-* -a, --access-key, and -s options for access keys have been
removed.  Use -I/--access-key-id and -S/--secret-key instead.

euca-* --config has been removed.  Use the "source" command to apply
the variables in a "eucarc" file to the environment instead.

euca-*'s EC2_ACCESS_KEY and EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variables have
been removed.  Use AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID and AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
instead.  (AWS_ACCESS_KEY and AWS_SECRET_KEY also work.)

euca-bundle-upload and euca-check-bucket have been removed.  Those
commands, intended only for consumption by eucalyptus node
controllers, have replaced by euca-bundle-and-upload-image, which is
fully supported for use by humans and machines alike.  As a
consequence of this change, installing euca2ools 3.1 on node
controllers earlier than version 4 will cause BundleInstance
operations to fail.

eustore-* have been removed due to their high maintenance burden and
poor user experience.  While it is possible that a replacement will
appear in the future, one has not yet been written.  To add a
pre-generated image to a cloud, download it from your distribution of
choice or from emis.eucalyptus.com and then either use
euca-bundle-and-upload-image and euca-register or the new import
service.

==== Deprecated features ====

The EUCA_REGION environment variable is deprecated in favor of the
more ubiquitous AWS_DEFAULT_REGION.

==== Additional changes ====

Searches for non-global configuration file options now always use "*"
as a last resort.  Specifically, this means that region and user
options search through file sections in this order:
 1. an exact match
 2. by replacing ":"-delimited bits with wildcards, from
most-specific to least-specific (e.g. a:b yields a:*, *:b, and so on)
 3. by prepending as few additional ":"-delimited bits as are needed
to make it match an existing section (e.g. us-east-1 yields
aws:us-east-1 as long as no other foo:us-east-1 sections exist that
would make things ambiguous)
 4. * (the global default)
In practice it behaves far more intuitively than it sounds.  :-\

All commands that accept the -I/--access-key-id and -S/--secret-key
options can now accept STS security tokens with the --security-token
command line option and the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable.
Support for obtaining STS credentials and automatically using instance
profile credentials remain unimplemented.

euare-servercertupload no longer requires a certificate chain.

(3.0.3) euca-* commands that have --filter options now support
wildcards in filters' values.

euca-authorize and euca-revoke accept common service names in place of
port numbers.  On most operating systems the list of services this
supports appears in /etc/services.

euca-bundle-image can now bundle block devices.

euca-bundle-image can now bundle stdin by specifying "-" as the file
to bundle.  Doing so makes the --prefix and --image-size options
mandatory.

(3.0.3) euca-bundle-instance now formats the upload policies it
generates correctly.

(3.0.3) euca-bundle-vol no longer ignores hidden files in the / directory.

euca-describe-images now displays block device mappings for ephemeral
volumes correctly.

(3.0.3) Most of the crashes that surface when
euca-get-console-output's output is redirected are now fixed.

(3.0.3) euca-register now always sends a root device name when
registering EBS images.  Prior to this release, certain combinations
of options would result in the default value for --root-device-name to
not be applied.

(3.0.3) euca-register now supports the "--platform windows" option.

euca-upload-bundle can now use an upload policy for authorization
instead of a secret key.

(3.0.3) euwatch-describe-alarms --show-long now shows alarms' ARNs.

(3.0.3) eulb-set-lb-policies-* now accept empty lists of policy names.

-- 
Garrett Holmstrom
Eucalyptus Systems Release Engineering
